did.unittitle: John Richard Behee sound recordings 1969-1974
did.abstract: Historian of University of Michigan athletics, most notably football. Sound cassettes of interviews with African American athletes regarding their experiences at the University of Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of John Behee (donor no. 4889).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, John Richard Behee Sound Recordings, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: John Behee received his doctorate at the University of Michigan. He is the author of two books on University of Michigan athletic history.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of audio cassettes of interviews with African American athletes regarding their experiences at the University of Michigan. Included is the proposal Behee wrote for the oral history project. The interviews were part of the Behee's research for his book Hail to the Victors.
